results.question: What is the purpose of unit testing?
results.correct_answer: To find problems early in the development cycle
incorrect_answers: To test the integration between different modules
To test the performance of the software

results.question: Which testing framework is commonly used for unit testing in JavaScript?
results.correct_answer: Jest

results.question: What is the purpose of the Jest --watchAll flag?
results.correct_answer: To run all tests and watch for changes
incorrect_answers: To run tests with code coverage analysis
To run tests in a specific environment

results.question: Which function is used in Jest to define a test?
results.correct_answer: test

results.question: What is the purpose of the expect function in Jest?
results.correct_answer: To define assertions for test expectations
incorrect_answers: To define the setup code for the test
To define the teardown code for the test

results.question: Which matcher function is used in Jest to check for equality?
results.correct_answer: toBe

results.question: What does the matcher toBeNull do in Jest?
results.correct_answer: Matches only null values

results.question: What does the matcher toContain do in Jest?
results.correct_answer: Checks if an array or iterable contains a particular item
incorrect_answers: Checks if a string contains a particular substring
Checks if an object has a specific property
Checks if a function throws an error

results.question: What is the purpose of E2E (End to End) testing?
results.correct_answer: To test the entire application flow from the user's perspective
incorrect_answers: To test individual units or components of the application
To test the performance of the application
To test the integration between different modules

results.question: Which tool is recommended for E2E testing in Next.js?
results.correct_answer: Cypress

results.question: What does Cypress use to run end-to-end tests?
results.correct_answer: A real browser

results.question: What is the purpose of the baseUrl configuration in Cypress?
results.correct_answer: To specify the base URL for relative URLs in commands
incorrect_answers: To specify the URL of the remote testing server
To specify the URL of the API endpoint
To specify the URL of the test runner

results.question: Which command is used in Cypress to visit a URL?
results.correct_answer: cy.visit

results.question: What does the command cy.contains do in Cypress?
results.correct_answer: Gets the DOM element containing the specified text
incorrect_answers: Clicks on the DOM element containing the specified text
Asserts that the DOM element contains the specified text
Types the specified text into the DOM element

results.question: What is the purpose of the command cy.click in Cypress?
results.correct_answer: To simulate a click on a DOM element
incorrect_answers: To assert that a DOM element is clickable
To get the value of a DOM element
To type text into a DOM

results.question: What is Unit Testing?
results.correct_answer: Unit testing finds problems early in the development cycle by testing individual units or components of a software application.
incorrect_answers: Unit testing is used to test the entire application as a whole.
Unit testing involves testing user interfaces and interactions.
Unit testing is only useful for manual testing.

results.question: Which testing framework is used for unit testing in Next.js?
results.correct_answer: Jest

results.question: What does the 'describe' function do in Jest?
results.correct_answer: It creates a block that groups several related tests together.
incorrect_answers: It defines a test, identified by a name.
It specifies the expected outcome of a test.
It sets up the testing environment.

results.question: What does the 'expect' function do in Jest?
results.correct_answer: It is used to define a complete 'expectation' for a value.
incorrect_answers: It creates a new test case.
It defines a group of tests.
It simulates user events in the application.

results.question: Which matcher is used to check if a value is equal to another value in Jest?
results.correct_answer: .toBe()

results.question: What does E2E testing stand for?
results.correct_answer: End to End testing

results.question: What is the primary purpose of E2E testing?
results.correct_answer: To test the entire application flow from start to finish, including user interactions and backend functionality.
incorrect_answers: To test individual units or components of a software application.
To focus only on testing user interfaces.
To identify bugs in the code before the development cycle starts.

results.question: Which testing tool is recommended for E2E testing in Next.js?
results.correct_answer: Cypress

results.question: What is the purpose of 'cy.visit()' in Cypress?
results.correct_answer: To visit (navigate to) a remote URL.
incorrect_answers: To get the current URL of the page.
To get one or more DOM elements by selector.

results.question: Which Cypress command is used to click a DOM element?
results.correct_answer: cy.click()

results.question: What is the primary benefit of unit testing?
results.correct_answer: Finding problems early in the development cycle
incorrect_answers: Validating the performance of the code

results.question: Which testing framework is used for unit testing Next.js code?
results.correct_answer: Jest

results.question: What is the command to create a new Next.js app with npm?
results.correct_answer: npx create-next-app my-app --use-npm

results.question: What command is used to install Jest as a development dependency?
results.correct_answer: npm install --save-dev jest

results.question: Which function is used to define a test block in Jest?
results.correct_answer: describe

results.question: Which function is used to define a test in Jest?
results.correct_answer: test

results.question: What is the purpose of the 'expect' function in Jest?
results.correct_answer: To create assertions for test expectations

results.question: What is the role of matchers in Jest?
results.correct_answer: To define expectations for test assertions

results.question: Which matcher is used to check if a value is null?
results.correct_answer: toBeNull

results.question: What does the 'toContain' matcher do in Jest?
results.correct_answer: Checks if an array or iterable contains a particular item
incorrect_answers: Checks if a string contains a substring
Checks if an object contains a property
Checks if a function throws an exception

results.question: In E2E testing, what is the role of Cypress?
results.correct_answer: A next-generation front-end testing tool for the modern web
incorrect_answers: A unit testing framework for Node.js
A tool for automated performance testing

results.question: What is the purpose of the 'cy.visit' command in Cypress?
results.correct_answer: To visit a remote URL
incorrect_answers: To type into a DOM element

results.question: What does the 'cy.get' command in Cypress do?
results.correct_answer: Get one or more DOM elements by selector or alias
incorrect_answers: Get the current URL of the page

results.question: What is the purpose of the 'cy.contains' command in Cypress?
results.correct_answer: Get the DOM element containing the text
incorrect_answers: Get the current URL of the page
Get one or more DOM elements by selector
Get the value of a DOM element

results.question: What is the purpose of the 'cy.click' command in Cypress?
results.correct_answer: Click a DOM element
incorrect_answers: Get one or more DOM elements by selector
Get the current URL of the page
